org.jtrim.concurrent

Interface CancelableTask


  • public interface CancelableTask
    Defines a task which can be canceled through a CancellationToken. There is no constraint on what an implementation of CancelableTask may do, it must implement its sole execute method do whatever task it wishes.

    How a task must respond to cancellation requests is implementation dependent but it may always terminate by throwing an OperationCanceledException.

    Thread safety

    The thread-safety property of CancelableTask is completely implementation dependent, so in general they does not need to be thread-safe.

    Synchronization transparency

    CancelableTask is not required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    CancelableFunction, TaskExecutor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(CancellationToken cancelToken)
      Executes the the implementation dependent task.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(CancellationToken cancelToken)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the the implementation dependent task. The task may check periodically the specified CancellationToken to detect cancellation requests and throw an OperationCanceledException. In case cancellation has been requested but this method does not throw an OperationCanceledException, it is assumed that this method ignored the cancellation request and completed normally.
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which can be checked periodically by this task to detect cancellation requests. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if the task detects that it was canceled (usually by checking the provided CancellationToken)
        java.lang.Exception - tasks may throw an exception they cannot handle. The executor should usually log these exceptions as severe problems.
